title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Labor Relations Specialists

content.rendered:
What is a Labor Relations Specialist?

Labor Relations Specialists write up labor contacts and interpret contracts that concern wage, pension, and other management issues.

Where does a Labor Relations Specialist work?

  • Labor unions
  • Government

How much does a Labor Relations Specialist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Labor Relations Specialist is $49,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Labor Relations Specialists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Economics majors
  • Business majors
  • Finance majors
Search Labor Relations Specialist jobs

Labor Relations Specialist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Labor Relations Specialists succeed in their work:

  • High attention to detail
  • Great listening and communication skills
  • Writing skills 

What are some common questions about Labor Relations Specialists?

Q: What degree do you need to be a Labor Relations Specialist?

A: Most employers are looking for individuals with bachelor’s degrees in a related field.
